Detailed Description

Authorize.Net class.

Implements the Authorize.Net AIM connection method.

Test credit card numbers.

  • 370000000000002 = American Express.
  • 6011000000000012 = Discover.
  • 5424000000000015 = MasterCard.
  • 4007000000027 = Visa.
  • 4222222222222 = Test account, set amount to desired response reason code.

The following constants must be defined:

  • BOO_AUTHORIZE_NET_LOGIN_ID = Your Authorize.Net API Login ID.
  • BOO_AUTHORIZE_NET_TRAN_KEY = Your Authorize.Net Transaction Key.
  • BOO_AUTHORIZE_NET_DEFAULT_MODE = The Authorize.Net default mode (set to 'live', 'test', or 'certification').
  • BOO_AUTHORIZE_NET_MD5 = Your Authorize.Net MD5 hash, leave blank if your not sure.
License:
http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt GNU General Public License
Link:
http://code.ramaboo.com/ Boo Framework
Copyright:
2009 David Singer
Author:
David Singer <david@ramaboo.com>
Version:
2.0.1
Required:
http://curl.haxx.se/ cURL version 7.15.0 or greater. SSL support must be enabled.
See also:
http://ramaboo.com/code/authorizenet/ Advanced Integration Method (AIM) Developer Guide
http://www.authorize.net/support/aim_guide.pdf
http://curl.haxx.se/docs/install.html

Definition at line 375 of file AuthorizeNet.php.

Referenced by htmlResultsUl().

Boo_AuthorizeNet::getAvsResultCode (  ) 

Indicates the result of AVS.

Posible values are:

  • A = Address (Street) matches, ZIP does not.
  • B = Address information not provided for AVS check.
  • E = AVS error.
  • G = Non-U.S. Card Issuing Bank.
  • N = No Match on Address (Street) or ZIP.
  • P = AVS not applicable for this transaction.
  • R = Retry - System unavailable or timed out.
  • S = Service not supported by issuer.
  • U = Address information is unavailable.
  • W = 9 digit ZIP matches, Address (Street) does not.
  • X = Address (Street) and 9 digit ZIP match.
  • Y = Address (Street) and 5 digit ZIP match.
  • Z = 5 digit ZIP matches, Address (Street) does not.
Returns:
string AVS result code.

Definition at line 397 of file AuthorizeNet.php.

Referenced by htmlResultsUl().

Boo_AuthorizeNet::getCardCodeResponseCode (  ) 

Indicates results of card code verification.

Posible values are:

  • M = Match.
  • N = No match.
  • P = Not processed.
  • S = Should have been present.
  • U = Issuer unable to process request.
Returns:
string The card code response code.

array Returns card types, key is a single letter, value is common name.

Definition at line 185 of file AuthorizeNet.php.

Boo_AuthorizeNet::getCavvResponseCode (  ) 

Indicates the results of cardholder authentication verification.

Posible values are:

  • null (or empty string) = CAVV not validated.
  • 0 = CAVV not validated because erroneous data was submitted.
  • 1 = CAVV failed validation.
  • 2 = CAVV passed validation.
  • 3 = CAVV validation could not be performed; issuer attempt incomplete.
  • 4 = CAVV validation could not be performed; issuer system error.
  • 5 = Reserved for future use.
  • 6 = Reserved for future use.
  • 7 = CAVV attempt - failed validation - issuer available (U.S.-issued card/non-U.S acquirer).
  • 8 = CAVV attempt - passed validation - issuer available (U.S.-issued card/non-U.S. acquirer).
  • 9 = CAVV attempt - failed validation - issuer unavailable (U.S.-issued card/non-U.S. acquirer).
  • A = CAVV attempt - passed validation - issuer unavailable (U.S.-issued card/non-U.S. acquirer).
  • B = CAVV passed validation, information only, no liability shift.
Returns:
string The cardholder authentication verification value response code.

Definition at line 275 of file AuthorizeNet.php.

Boo_AuthorizeNet::getResponseCode (  ) 

Indicates the result of the transaction.

Posible values are:

  • 0 = Response code is not yet set.
  • 1 = This transaction has been approved.
  • 2 = This transaction has been declined.
  • 3 = There has been an error processing this transaction.
  • 4 = This transaction is being held for review.
Returns:
int The response code.

Definition at line 289 of file AuthorizeNet.php.

Referenced by getResponseCodeWord(), and htmlResultsUl().

Boo_AuthorizeNet::getResponseCodeWord (  ) 

Returns the word associated with the response code.

Possible return values are:

  • unset
  • approved
  • declined
  • error
  • held
Returns:
string The word associated with the response code (lowercase), FALSE on failure.

Boo_AuthorizeNet::htmlResultsUl ( array $  attrs = array(),
$  debug = BOO_DEBUG 
)

Gets the results as a HTML unordred list.

Parameters:
array $attrs[optional] Array of attributes.
bool $debug[optional] Debug mode.
Returns:
Boo_Html_Ul The results link as a HTML unordred list, FALSE on failure.
Warning:
This method will display sensitive information including everything sent to Authorize.Net. Be careful how you use it!

Boo_AuthorizeNet::htmlTestForm ( array $  attrs = array()  ) 

Returns HTML test form.

This function is usefully for generating a simple HTML form for testing Authorize.Net transactions. This form should only be used for testing purposes and is not secure.

Parameters:
array $attrs[optional] Array of attributes.
Returns:
Boo_Html_Form The HTML form on success, FALSE otherwise.

Boo_AuthorizeNet::setMode ( $  mode  ) 

Sets the mode.

Posible values are:

  • live = For production use.
  • test = Test mode.
  • certification = Certification mode.
Parameters:
string $mode The mode.
Returns:
bool Returns TURE if mode was set, FALSE otherwise.
Warning:
Test mode and certification mode can cause problems try Boo_AuthorizeNet::testRequest() if you recieve error 13.

Boo_AuthorizeNet::$transactionId = '' [protected]

Transaction identifier.

10 digit string.

Warning:
Do not store as INT. Value can be greater than 2147483647 or 4294967295. BIGINT or CHAR(10) are safe.
